properties.name: Gainesville
properties.description: Posted by Volleyballa14When there was talk of building a University of Florida, Gainesville offered land, money, and an agreement to "furnish water to the University without charge." When the telegraph office in Gainesville anounced that the University would be built in their city the people started ringing church bells and firecrakers along with a parade. The University of Florida is "what Money magazine calls \'the best place to live\' in the United States." UF focuses on excellence in research, teaching, technology, and athletics. In fact the University has had very good seasons recently in both football and basketball leading to being national champions!

properties.name: Honolulu
properties.description: Posted by Volleyballa14After the Civil War hard times came to the Bahamas until the 1920\'s and Prohibition made the islands a base for "rum-running". After the Prohibition law was repealed, the Bahamas went into a slowed economy again. The economy didn\'t return to normal until World War II, when the islands were used as an air and sea way-station. Shortly after the war the new industry of tourism came to the Bahamas and changed the priorities in the islands. The beauty of the islands were appreciated for the first time. The Bahamas became one of the world\'s most popular tourist destinations in the 1950\'s when Cuba closed its borders to US tourists. In 1964 Great Britain granted the Bahamas self-government and in 1969 changed their status from a colony to a Commonwealth. In 1973 the Bahamas became independent within the Commonwealth of Nations, but Queen Elizabeth II retained them as constitutional head of state.

properties.name: Lakeland
properties.description: Posted by Volleyballa14I live here! It is a growing city in central Florida and has many places to hang out and have fun. I was born here at Lakeland Regional Hospital. I have gone to Lakeland Christian since second grade. I am now in ninth grade so I have been here for eight years. I have a lot of family here in lakeland. My grandma lives on the north side of town and I live by George Jenkins. I play volleyball and basketball for my school and I play club for volleyball as well. My club team is amazing! I play for LAVA or Lakeland Area Volleyball Association.

properties.name: Niagara Falls
properties.description: Posted by Volleyballa14Niagara Falls was initially only 11 meters, 35 feet. As the water flowed over the Falls to the river below, it began eating through the glacial material and the limestone rock of the Niagara Escarpment and began the formation of the Niagara Gorge. A geologist named Doctor Roy Spencer discovered the birth site of Niagara Falls and today this site is known as "Roy Terrace". When Niagara Falls first came into existance the flow rate of water was only twenty-five percent of the present flow rate. Scientists have calculated that the volume of water flowing over the Falls initially was 37,500 cubic feet per second. Niagara Falls has also eroded 11.4 kilometers, or 7.1 miles. In 1938, the deepest flow of water at the crest of the Horseshoe Falls was recorded at 7.6 meters or 25 feet.

properties.name: Okavongo Delta
properties.description: Posted by Volleyballa14 I totally went on vacation here for three weeks! My grandparents took my mom, dad, and me on a safari for their 50th wedding annaversary. I took 1,200 pictures while I was here. The scenery is beautiful and the wildlife is everywhere. We stayed in tents at twelve different camps. I saw cheetahs, lions, elephants, and many other animals. My mom was walking to the tent one day after breakfast and an elphant was in the path. She thought she could just walk past and get to our tent with out it seeing her. She was wrong! It not only saw her, it charged her! When she tried to run away she tripped and fell. Luckily it stopped other wise I might not have a mom today.

properties.name: Paris
properties.description: Posted by Volleyballa14parisWhen the eiffel tower was first built many people were against it. Environmentalist were afraid it would obstruct the birds flight pattern and many were just against the use of money for such a building. Even with the complaints the tower\'s building cost were almost completely covered by ticket sales from people coming to ride the elevator nine hundred feet up to the third floor observation deck in the first year alone. I can only imagine how pretty it must be to stand on the observation deck and see all of Paris or watch a sun set! Another reason I want to go to Paris is for the language. French is so pretty to listen to. It doesn\'t matter if I can understand it I just love to hear the fluidity of the words. Also you can\'t forget the food. It\'s French food thats enough to make me want a crossant!

properties.name: Sydney
properties.description: Posted by Volleyballa14I want to go to Sydney, Australia to see the Opera House. The Sydney Opera House was opened in October of 1973 by Queen Elizabeth ll. The first show to be performed there was the Australian Opera\'s production of Sergei Prokofiev\'s "War and Peace". Jorn Utzon, a Danish architect, designed the Sydney Opera House. He designed the opera house to reflect things in the environment. The roof of the building resembles the sails of ships in the harbor.

properties.name: The Bahamas
properties.description: Posted by Volleyballa14The first documented name for the Bahamas was "Baja Mar". This Spanish name is actually misleading because it means "shallow sea" when really the Bahamas are mountain plateaus that emerged from the Atlantic Ocean a long time ago. Then later in history tourism came to the Bahamas. In the 1950\'s Cuba became closed to US tourists and the Bahamas became one of the worlds most popular tourist destinations.

properties.name: Tokyo
properties.description: Posted by Volleyballa14In 1942, WWII, Tokyo came under an attack known as the Doolittle Raid. This was its first air raid by US bombers. This raid followed soon after the Pearl Harbour attack on December 1941. In 1943, Tokyo Prefecture and Tokyo city merged to form Tokyo Metropolis or Tokyo-to. This is commonly called Tokyo today. Since this time, no city in Japan has had the name "Tokyo". In 1945 Tokyo was heavily bombed again, and much of the city was destroyed by heavy bombardment by B-29 and other aircraft. Long streches of land were levelled both by the explosions and by the following fires. The damage was not limited to Tokyo City, but extended to the city of Hachioji and other cities in western Tokyo. The bombers targeted air bases, transportation facilities, and strategically important manufacturing plants. The population in 1945 was only half of the population of 1940 due to the heavy death toll and populace fleeing to the countryside.

properties.name: Victoria Falls
properties.description: Posted by Volleyballa14While we were in Africa we went to Victoria Falls. We took a helicopter over and around the falls then later went back and walked around. My dad and I got in the water at the top for a picture and my mom almost had a heart attack! We weren\'t even the most daring! Two girls walked all the way across right above the falls to an island for lunch. Personally I think that Victoria Falls is prettier than Niagra Falls and was much larger. We learned that the falls had actually moved eight times in known history because of the rock eroding behind the falls. Victoria Falls is also the widest, strechting over a mile long, and has more water pouring over it than any other falls known. It is also known for pouring over into a small chasm so that you can actually stand very close facing the falls and get wet.
